Acciaccatura.definition: An extra, very fast grace note
Acciaccatura.zh-CN: 额外的、非常快的装饰音
Acciaccatura.zh: 額外的、非常快的裝飾音

Appoggiatura.definition: A type of ornament that creates a yearning effect

Arco.definition: Cancels col legno and pizzicato. (In any string passage, arco is usually expected, as it is the default approach; it is only ever written at the end of col legno or pizzicato passages.)
Arco.zh-CN: 取消col legno（用琴弓敲击琴弦）和pizzicato（拨奏）
Arco.zh: 取消col legno（用琴弓敲擊琴弦）和pizzicato（撥奏）

Arpeggio.definition: A chord with the notes spread out in time (rather than sounded simultaneously)
Arpeggio.zh-CN: 琶音：音符分开从下至上（或上至下）演奏（而不是同时响起）
Arpeggio.zh: 琶音：音符分開從下至上（或上至下）演奏（而不是同時響起）

Basso continuo.definition: Continuous bass accompaniment by chordal instrument(s) and bass instrument(s) (see figured bass.)
Basso continuo.zh-CN: 由和弦乐器和低音乐器连续低音伴奏
Basso continuo.zh: 由和弦樂器和低音樂器連續低音伴奏

A bocca chiusa.definition: Wordless humming in a choral piece

Chiuso.definition: Calls for a horn to be muted by hand.
Chiuso.zh-CN: 要求用手将号（铜管）“静音”
Chiuso.zh: 要求用手將號（銅管）「靜音」

Coloratura.definition: Elaborate ornamentation of a vocal line
Coloratura.zh-CN: 花腔：是一种华丽的演唱技巧，主要应用于西洋古典音乐中，以装饰音多而难度大而著名
Coloratura.zh: 花腔：是一種華麗的演唱技巧，主要應用於西洋古典音樂中，以裝飾音多而難度大而著名

Coperti.definition: Of a drum, muted with a cloth

Una corda.definition: On a piano, played with the soft pedal depressed
Una corda.zh-CN: 在钢琴上，踩下柔音踏板进行演奏（一条弦）
Una corda.zh: 在鋼琴上，踩下柔音踏板進行演奏（一條弦）

Due corde.definition: On a piano, played with the soft pedal depressed (For why both terms exist, see Piano#Pedals.)
Due corde.zh-CN: 在钢琴上，半放开 / 半踩下柔音踏板进行演奏（两条弦）
Due corde.zh: 在鋼琴上，半放開 / 半踩下柔音踏板進行演奏（兩條弦）

Tre corde or tutte le corde.italian: Tre corde or tutte le corde
Tre corde or tutte le corde.translation: three strings or all the strings
Tre corde or tutte le corde.zh-CN: 取消使用一条弦：在钢琴上完全放开柔音踏板进行演奏（三条弦）
Tre corde or tutte le corde.zh: 取消使用一條弦：在鋼琴上完全放開柔音踏板進行演奏（三條弦）

Glissando.definition: A sweeping glide from one pitch to another used for dramatic effect
Glissando.zh-CN: 从一个音到另一个音快速滑行，用于产生戏剧性的感觉
Glissando.zh: 從一個音到另一個音快速滑行，用於產生戲劇性的感覺

Legato.definition: A series of notes played with a smooth connection between them
Legato.zh-CN: 流畅：一系列音符之间的流畅连接演奏
Legato.zh: 流暢：一系列音符之間的流暢連接演奏

Col legno.definition: Calls for a bowed instrument's strings to be struck with the wood of the bow (rather than drawn across with the hair of the bow).

Martellato.definition: Of notes, strongly accented and detached

Pizzicato.definition: Calls for a bowed instrument's strings to be plucked with the fingers.
Pizzicato.zh-CN: 拨奏：要求用手指拨动弓形乐器的琴弦
Pizzicato.zh: 撥奏：要求用手指撥動弓形樂器的琴弦

Portamento.definition: Playing with a sliding of pitch between two notes
Portamento.zh-CN: 滑音：在两个音符之间滑动（同根琴弦上滑动）进行演奏
Portamento.zh: 滑音：在兩個音符之間滑動（同根琴弦上滑動）進行演奏

Portato.definition: Played in a style between staccato and legato
Portato.zh-CN: 演奏风格介于断奏和连奏之间
Portato.zh: 演奏風格介於斷奏和連奏之間

Sforzando.zh-CN: 演奏时有强烈、明显的强调
Sforzando.zh: 演奏時有強烈、明顯的強調

Con sordino.definition: With mute applied, esp. to string instruments

Spiccato.definition: With a stringed instrument, played by bouncing the bow lightly on the strings
Spiccato.zh-CN: 跳弓：在琴弦上轻轻演奏
Spiccato.zh: 跳弓：在琴弦上輕輕演奏

Staccato.definition: A form of musical articulation in which notes are distinct and separated from each other by short gaps
Staccato.zh-CN: 跳音：一种音乐发音形式，其中音符清晰且彼此间隔较短
Staccato.zh: 跳音：一種音樂發音形式，其中音符清晰且彼此間隔較短

Tutti.definition: Played or sung by the entire ensemble, rather than by just a soloist or principal player
Tutti.zh-CN: 由整个乐团演奏或演唱，而不仅仅是独奏者或主要演奏者
Tutti.zh: 由整個樂團演奏或演唱，而不僅僅是獨奏者或主要演奏者

Vibrato.definition: Played with rapid repetitive variation or undulation in pitch
Vibrato.zh-CN: 振音（颤音，但不是Thrill）：以快速重复的音调变化或波动进行演奏（弦乐器主要是借由手指在弦上的揉动；声乐和管乐亦能使用）
Vibrato.zh: 振音（顫音，但不是Thrill）：以快速重復的音調變化或波動進行演奏（弦樂器主要是借由手指在弦上的揉動；聲樂和管樂亦能使用）

Colla voce.definition: (For accompanists) In time with the singer's text, especially when slowing for textual effect
Colla voce.zh-CN: （对于伴奏者）与歌手的歌词同步，尤其是为了效果放慢速度时
Colla voce.zh: （對於伴奏者）與歌手的歌詞同步，尤其是為了效果放慢速度時
